    Prepare for PSUT analysis

    Matthew Kuperus Heun

    2019-03-24

    prep_psut.Rmd

    Introduction

    After loading IEA data and ensuring that the data are balanced (see (http://IEATools.html)), the analyst can prepare for further work. One option might be preparation for physical supply-use table (PSUT) analysis. This vignette shows how to use the functions in the IEATools package for that purpose.

    Extract matrices for PSUT analysis

    Unit summation matrices (S_units)

    Unit summation matrices (S_units) can be extracted from a tidy data frame with the extract_S_units_from_tidy() function.

    library(dplyr)
library(IEATools)
Tidy_IEA_df <- load_tidy_iea_df()
S_units_mats <- Tidy_IEA_df %>% 
  group_by(Country, Year, Energy.type) %>% 
  extract_S_units_from_tidy()
glimpse(S_units_mats)
#> Observations: 4
#> Variables: 4
#> $ Country     <chr> "GH", "GH", "ZA", "ZA"
#> $ Year        <chr> "1971", "2000", "1971", "2000"
#> $ Energy.type <chr> "E", "E", "E", "E"
#> $ S_units     <list> [<matrix[14 x 1]>, <matrix[16 x 1]>, <matrix[21 x 1…
S_units_mats$S_units[[1]]
#>                                       ktoe
#> Aviation gasoline                        1
#> Charcoal                                 1
#> Crude oil                                1
#> Electricity                              1
#> Fuel oil                                 1
#> Gas/diesel oil excl. biofuels            1
#> Hydro                                    1
#> Kerosene type jet fuel excl. biofuels    1
#> Liquefied petroleum gases (LPG)          1
#> Lubricants                               1
#> Motor gasoline excl. biofuels            1
#> Other kerosene                           1
#> Primary solid biofuels                   1
#> Refinery gas                             1
#> attr(,"rowtype")
#> [1] "Product"
#> attr(,"coltype")
#> [1] "Unit"
